summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 29, 2020, discussing recruiting volunteer assistance for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. A special agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad seeks help with evidence preparation, organization, and review, including listening to recordings.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: The sender of the main email, seeking volunteer assistance for evidence work related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: SA M
persons.context: The recipient of the initial volunteer offer email, addressed by SA from SOG Squad C-20.

persons.name: SA SO-4
persons.context: The sender of the initial volunteer offer email, identifying as part of SOG (likely Special Operations Group) Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT), expressing interest in assisting with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

connections.description: SA SO-4 emails SA M to volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, indicating a professional working relationship within the FBI.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: The New York Field Office agent responds to SA SO-4's volunteer offer, outlining the assistance needed, showing coordination on the investigation.

events.title: FBI Volunteer Recruitment for Epstein/Maxwell Investigation
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss recruiting volunteer agents to assist with evidence preparation, organization, and review for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The needed assistance involved preparing and organizing evidence for discovery, reviewing items, and listening to recordings.
The investigation was being handled by the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad in the New York Field Office and involved SOG Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT).
The case is referred to as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' within the FBI.
The email chain indicates ongoing investigative activity and evidence processing well after Epstein's 2019 arrest and death.
